description:
Welcome to Hearst Corporation, a leading media and information company with a portfolio of iconic brands across print, digital, and television platforms. We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Director of Data & Analytics to join our team and lead our data-driven strategies and insights. As the Director, you will play a critical role in driving innovation and growth through the utilization of data and analytics. If you are a dynamic leader with a passion for data and a track record of success in driving business impact, we want to hear from you!

Develop and implement data and analytics strategies in line with the company's overall goals and objectives.
Lead a team of data analysts and scientists in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various sources.
Utilize data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that will inform business decisions and drive growth.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and editorial, to identify and prioritize data needs.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in data and analytics, and make recommendations for incorporating new technologies and methodologies.
Create and maintain data governance policies and procedures to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security.
Communicate data insights and recommendations to senior leadership and other stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Develop and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of data-driven initiatives and strategies.
Manage data and analytics budgets, including identifying and negotiating with third-party vendors.
Train and mentor team members to expand their knowledge and skills in data and analytics.
Foster a culture of data-driven decision making and promote the use of data throughout the organization.
Continuously evaluate and optimize data processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
Represent the company at industry events and conferences to showcase our data and analytics capabilities.
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and maintain ethical standards in handling sensitive data.
Collaborate with legal and compliance teams to ensure data practices are in line with company policies and regulations.

Hearst Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
